A clear, culturally sensitive mental health library would give people access to trusted knowledge in plain language. It reduces stigma, promotes early help-seeking, and builds understanding within families and communities.

 

Measurable Impacts/Values

  • Reach measured by library visits and downloads
  • Number of topics and languages available
  • Increase in help-seeking behavior and local referrals
  • Growth in professional volunteers and contributors
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: In low-income countries, three in four people with mental health conditions receive no treatment. Services are scarce, stigma is strong, and information is locked behind complex clinical language. Cultural silence leaves many suffering alone without guidance or help.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The library provides text, illustrations, and audio on topics like grief, anxiety, trauma, and depression. Each section offers practical, evidence-based guidance reviewed by professionals. Content works offline and is available in printable and visual formats for community centers and schools.

ServiceNow Applications and Capabilities Used

  • Knowledge Management stores and organizes materials. 
  • Workflow automation ensures review before publishing.
  • Service Portal offers anonymous access.
  • Virtual Agent guides unsure users.
  • Accessibility and multilingual features improve reach.
  • Document Generation produces printable guides, while Integration Hub connects with crisis helplines.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • ServiceNow Knowledge Management, Portal, and Flow Designer
  • Integration Hub for external helplines
  • Cloud storage and multilingual libraries
  • Audio and visual media handling

 

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Ensuring clinical accuracy with limited experts, adapting across cultures, keeping crisis contacts updated, and protecting users from triggering content while maintaining privacy and ethical standards.
